result.execSummary:
The defendant Walter D. Pattion Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Walter D. Pattion Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Walter D. Pattion Jr was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Walter D. Pattion Jr was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: On each count concurrent.  PSI WAIVED.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Undertake AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

Defendant shall Maintain Absolute Sobriety.  No use or possession of controlled substances, unless prescribed by a physician.   No possession of drug paraphernalia.  No possession or consumption of intoxicants.

Complete compas assessment,  counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate and followup.    Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections and follow rules of supervision.Defendant shall provide a DNA sample by calling the Work Release Unit  at 920-232-1915 or 920-232-1919 WITHIN 72 HOURS OF SENTENCING to set up an appointment.   The Work Release Units hours are 8:00 am-4:00 pm/Monday thru Friday. Defendant shall provide proof of identification along with the court minutes stating a DNA sample is required.  Failure to comply with this order may result in either a finding of contempt of court or a criminal charge of Failure to Provide a DNA Sample pursuant to Wis. Stats. 946.52.

timeConds.notes: On each count concurrent.  Huber granted, if in compliance with jail facility regulations.  Defendant currently in custody at the Winnebago County Jail.
IMPOSED & STAYED.  On each count concurrent - Stay may be lifted, in whole or in part, upon written request of the agent with approval and order of the court.
